title: Why was Georginio Rutter's Brighton goal vs West Ham not ruled out?
description: Georginio Rutter's late equaliser in Brighton's 1-1 draw with West Ham on Sunday was allowed to stand despite handball claims. BBC Sport looks at the rules to explain why.
content:
Nuno Espirito Santo furiously watched two Premier League points slip from West Ham's grasp on Sunday as Brighton's Georginio Rutter netted in the 91st minute to cancel out Jarrod Bowen's opener.

title: Essex student stabbed to death in Southampton was 'kind and talented'
description: The family of Henry Nowak, 18, pay tribute to their "kind, intelligent and talented son".
content:
The family of a university student who died after being stabbed in the chest while on a night out have described the "devastating" loss of a "kind, intelligent and talented son".

title: Mohamed Salah: Liverpool fans give their verdict on Egyptian star
description: BBC Sport visits Anfield to find out how Liverpool fans are feeling following Mohamed Salah's explosive interview after being left out the side for a third straight game.
content:
Mohamed Salah set off a storm at Liverpool with his explosive interview delivered across the M62 at Leeds on Saturday night.
So how were Reds fans feeling as they reflected on events a day later?
We headed to a grey, wet and windy Anfield to find out... [3976 chars]

title: Over-confident Londoners ‘more likely to crash on rural roads’
description: Nearly 10,000 people have lost their lives on rural roads in the past decade, two thirds more than on urban roads
content: Analysis of Department for Transport figures shows that 9,887 people were killed on rural roads in the past ten years, two thirds more than the number on urban roads. In 2024, 956 people were killed on country roads, 72 per cent more than the 555 on ... [2804 chars]

title: school in garden to avoid 'oppressive' UK education system
description: Samuel Leeds now employs two full-time teachers and runs finance classes himself
